result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott C Tolliver

records.addlTxt: Defendant turned over to WRC, hearing set for 10/7 removed from the calendar.
Competency hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Copy of minutes from CH Hrg on 7/8/22 sent electronically to DCJ. Copy of order for commitment sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The state does not object to the report. DE in agreement with the report. Court made findings and finds DE not competent and in patient, forthwith.
Copy of minutes from CH Hrg on 6/14/22 sent electronically to DCJ. Copy of order for competency exam sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program.

Joint hearing on 21CF2457/22CF1119/1120. Attorney Erin Nagy in court for Defendant Scott C Tolliver. Prosecuting Atty Daniel Hess appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott C Tolliver in court in custody. Atty. Nagy states stipulation for inpatient examination to be ordered. Court makes findings, orders inpatient competency evaluation.
Copy of order for competency exam by DHS sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program.
Competency hearing on June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Erin Nagy in court for Defendant Scott C Tolliver. Prosecuting Atty Daniel R. Hess appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott C Tolliver in court in custody. Atty. Nagy raises competency for DE. Atty. Hess states no objections. Court orders competency evaluations in 22CF1119/1120/ and 21CF2457.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not be at any Walgreens in Dane County. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

01:43 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
